instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3071 turn off
threads.message: hello this board It turns off after a while of using it, how do I determine that it is indeed video damage?

threads.title: 820-3071 turn off
threads.message: Run GPU a stress test (Unigine Heaven/Valley, for example) and see if crashes immediatelly.

threads.title: 820-3071 turn off
threads.message: ok,  the computer is only turn on in bypass mode, do you think it is due to the gpu

threads.title: 820-3071 turn off
threads.message: Then you have a problem with some SMC sensor; check VSENSE and ISENSE outputs.

threads.title: 820-3071 turn off
threads.message: Can you help me with the schematic and boardview for this board that I can't find?

threads.title: 820-3071 turn off
threads.message:
Do you mean the RIO board?
I don't see a code for MLB...

threads.title: 820-3071 turn off
threads.message: ok tengo una duda, donde mido vsense,isense hay muchos puntos donde esta, quien genera vsense, isense en que pagina estos sensores smc

threads.title: 820-3071 turn off
threads.message:
Machine turns on in SMC bypass mode and loads macOS?
If yes, run HWMonitor and post the screenshot.

Check SMC_DCIN/PBUS_VSENSE and SMC_DCIN/CHGR_BMON_ISENSE.
Be sure to have correct resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of U7000.

threads.title: 820-3071 turn off
threads.message:
Check SMC_DCIN/PBUS_VSENSE and SMC_DCIN/CHGR_BMON_ISENSE.All 0v, its normal? the computer must be turned on SMC bypass
SMC_DCIN=2.3
PBUS_VSENSE=1.4v
CHGR_BMON_ISENSE=0v
resistance pin 17/18 and 27/28 is good.Yes load macos, but they only load some 2 items HW MONITOR, I've tried adding other files but it's still the same.

threads.title: 820-3071 turn off
threads.message: Possibly bad solders under SMC; reball it.
